## Introduction
Stovetop Greek Lemon Rice, also known as "Avgolemono" in Greek cuisine, is a delicious and comforting side dish that is popular in Mediterranean cooking. This dish is made with rice, chicken broth, lemon juice, and eggs, creating a creamy and tangy flavor profile. It is often served alongside grilled meats or as part of a larger Greek feast.

## Ingredients
- 1 cup long-grain white rice
- 2 cups chicken broth
- 1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice
- 2 large eggs
- Salt, to taste
- Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
- Fresh parsley, for garnish

## Equipment
- Medium-sized saucepan with a lid
- Whisk
- Fork

## Preparation Time
- 5 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 20 minutes

## Steps
1. In a medium-sized saucepan, bring the chicken broth to a boil over medium heat.
2. Add the rice to the boiling broth, reduce the heat to low, and cover the saucepan with a lid. Simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and tender.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the lemon juice and eggs until well combined.
4. Slowly pour the lemon and egg mixture into the cooked rice, stirring continuously to prevent the eggs from curdling. The heat of the rice will cook the eggs and create a creamy texture.
5. Season the rice with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
6. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the rice sit for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. Fluff the rice with a fork before serving.
8. Garnish with fresh parsley for added freshness and color.

## Serving Suggestions
- Stovetop Greek Lemon Rice is a versatile dish that can be served as a side with grilled chicken, lamb, or fish.
- It pairs well with Mediterranean-inspired salads or roasted vegetables.
- You can also enjoy it as a main course by adding cooked chicken or shrimp.

## Variations
- For a vegetarian version, substitute vegetable broth for the chicken broth.
- Add diced cooked chicken, shrimp, or vegetables to make it a complete meal.
- For added flavor, saut√© diced onions and garlic in olive oil before adding the rice and broth.
- Some variations include adding chopped fresh dill or mint for an extra layer of herbaceousness.

## Tips and Tricks
- Use freshly squeezed lemon juice for the best flavor.
- Be sure to whisk the lemon and egg mixture well to ensure a smooth and creamy consistency.
- Adjust the amount of lemon juice according to your taste preference. If you prefer a stronger lemon flavor, you can add more lemon juice.
- Avoid overcooking the rice to prevent it from becoming mushy.

## Nutritional Information

## Storage and Leftovers
- Stovetop Greek Lemon Rice can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- Reheat leftovers in the microwave or on the stovetop with a splash of water or broth to prevent drying out.

## Frequently Asked Questions
1. Can I use brown rice instead of white rice?
   - Yes, you can use brown rice, but keep in mind that the cooking time will be longer.
2. Can I use vegetable broth instead of chicken broth?
   - Absolutely! Vegetable broth works well as a substitute for a vegetarian version.
3. Can I freeze Stovetop Greek Lemon Rice?
   - It is not recommended to freeze this dish as the texture may change upon thawing. It is best enjoyed fresh.
